definition: adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: In the third cart were Mulan and her sister Mochow and the adopted daughter, whose name was Coral.
sentences.chinese: 第三辆车上是木兰跟她妹妹莫愁，还有干女儿珊瑚。

sentences.english: That young woman is his adopted daughter and a widow.
sentences.chinese: 这位姑娘是他的干女儿，还是个寡妇呢。

sentences.english: Sometime ago, my god-daughter brought me to Singapore River to look at lantern.
sentences.chinese: 几个星期前，干女儿陪我到新加坡看灯笼。

definition: adopted son (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
adoptive father (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
adoptive mother (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
adoptive mother (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
